review: The Rust that's available to play now on Steam doesn't look remotely like the Rust you might have played last year. Though you can still play that classic version through the game's launcher (under the title Rust Legacy) developer Facepunch has been slowly iterating on a new version of the title for months a build running on a new sleeker engine. However a few features from classic Rust have yet to be implemented in its prettier successor fans of Radtown scavenging for instance are going to be left out in the cold.It really doesn't matter how kind and forgiving a person you may be when you're playing Rust you're playing The Most Dangerous Game.It's a difficult game to describe and not because its core mechanics which blend DayZ's survivalism with Minecraft's resource collection and crafting are especially complicated. It's because no matter how you talk about Rust it never sounds like much fun. "Oh yeah I collected wood and stones for an hour made a bow killed a deer and then someone shot me with a hunting rifle and I started from scratch."Yes that sounds terrific. I'll take two.The true joys of Rust are found in its unexpected emergent moments of interaction with its deadly world and deadlier humans. For example this Overview video started off with Justin and I trying to showcase the basics of survival when starting a new life in Rust which was going really well until we stared into the mouth of madness and became the monster we feared so much.

review: What can I say about this game that people already haven't?I suppose I should start by saying that this game is hard. Really hard at least for newcomers looking for a new survival game to play. This is by no means a "realistic Minecraft" in any way. Don't expect to be able to get far in this game fast by going solo or even with just 1 other friend to help you. As much potential as this game has I find it hard to play it without getting extremely frustrated by the fact no matter what you try to obtain to build a life for yourself in this game it can all be taken away with one well placed shot from a player more equipped than you (This is all based of PVP servers).I understand that that's the point of this game that it gives you the option to choose whatever path you take in this game whether that be good or bad but that's also the one of the game's flaws that can't really be changed since you run the risk of restricting the player to begin with. Unless you're just starting out 9 times out of 10 you'll just be gunning down every person that you stumble across. You kill them so that already sets them back in terms of items that they had on them and unless they had a spawn point and a decent base with extra supplies built up that means they start back from square one all over again. And even if they had a base built up I'm sure it would've taken some. if not a lot of those supplies to make whatever they had in the first place anyway. Killing other players off when you get the chance only gets you benefits in the long run.This is an Alpha though so I guess I really shouldn't be saying too much in terms of flaws this game might have since there is already bound to be SOME. I guess my only other question is "How can they fix a part of the game that should give you free will to decide without restricting the player?" I'm eager to see if they can come up with one.As for actually recommending this I would definitely do so but just remember one thing. This game IS NOT for the casual player. If you really want to play this game and get things fast play it with about 3 5 other friends if you can.Strength in numbers.

review: Psyonix's 'Rocket League' created in the unreal engine has offered an experience unlike any other. The gameplay is simplistic yet can be utilized with a wide variety of skill and technique. A player can have fun and be good at the game within 20 minutes of picking the game up but cannot truly master some of the techniques until he has clocked hundreds of hours into the game. Because of the gameplay of Rocket League it is unusual that a game will end in a severe blowout or that one team will seriously outperform the other as it is difficult to be very good or very bad at the game. The AI while generally not as tactic wise as a player tends to perform at a level similar to most players and therefore being with an AI in no terms means a certain defeat. The games are short just 5 minutes long which is plenty of time for about 3 4 goals to be scored in total so both teams are always still in the competition a game is rarely over until the last 10 seconds or so. The games are short enough so that if the teams DO end up somewhat stacked the less skilled team will not have to endure a slaughter for an extended time which we often find in many FPS games in which a winner can clearly be determined after about half of a match. Also it is unnecessary for a player to have a great deal of soccer knowledge or experience as the gameplay is while similar in some regards quite different in most. The game features 3 play modes "Online" "Exhibition" and "Season". All play modes offer the options of playing 1v1 referred to as "Duel" 2v2 or "Doubles" 3v3 which is "Standard" and 4v4 called "Chaos". Exhibitions are exactly what you would expect them to be you can quickly set up and play a game strictly with AIs. A "Season" allows you to set up and play other AI teams in an attempt to make the playoffs and continue on to win the tournament. Unfortunately the only number of other teams that can participate is 9 for a total of 10 teams competiting. You can play either a 9 18 27 or 36 week season so each team plays every other team an even number of times. From there either 4 or 6 teams make the playoffs which are single elimination. "Online" allows you to play with other players from around the globe which you may do with a party of your friends or solo. You may also play private games with strictly your friends and AIs. Matchmaking is quick and easy it allows you to select what servers you wish to use hit go and you get into a match generally within 30 seconds. The only downsides I see to this game as of now is the lack of play modes. The season idea is excellent but it would be nice if it was expandable to allow more teams and more customizability. Another idea would be multiplayer tournaments in which 8 teams maybe more could play a single elimination tournament online. If a player were to quit out of his team he could recieve a temporary tournament play suspension. I feel that this would be an excellent addition that would allow especially for party play more competition into the game.Overall I give Rocket League a 9.5/10.

review: I have heard both good and bad reviews for this game but I cannot deny that above all this game is FUN! it's a weird brand of fun though and I know it's not for everyone ( different strokes for different folks and all that ) sure it has it's problems but it's still in it's infancy and it's already massively popular for good reason. Don't be mislead by those that condemn this game for it's micro transactions ( for the love of pete it's only for cosmetic items like t shirts and ball caps ) and besides the developers are only following the business patterns of the industry and you can't fault them for wanting to get paid for a product they are selling. If you don't want to spend your parents hard earned money on crates you dont have to. The idea of the game is solid fresh and above all FUN! ( there's that word again you spoiled mouth breathing trolls remember fun yeah? ) it's a no hold barred shootfest across a massive island that has more character and soul than anything triple A developers in the industry are pumping out every six months and it doesnt even have a single player campaign you loot scoot and shoot your way to an ever decreasing playing field all the while looking over your shoulder for the guy or gal that's going to fill you full of lead or run you over with a jeep or pummel you with a frying pan Samwise Gamgee style or blow you up with a frag grenade heck you could even have the misfortune of being hit by one of the many random artillery strikes that occur all across the map to discourage camping sure sometimes i last as long as a 16 year old boy losing his virginity on prom night but you can just back out once you're dead and go at it again (like a 16 year old boy on prom night) rinse and repeat over and over again until you've had enough punishment and call it quits (or rage quit if your mum doesn't or didnt hold you enough).the one issue I personally have the biggest problem with is no mic mute. So for the first minute or so while you wait to deploy your auditory senses are treated to the chorus of spastics who will wail curse rock out attempt to rap use every curse word in the english (and other) language eat thier mics call eachother homosexuals proclaim that *insert name of country here* is number one tell eachother to shut up and generally be belligerent and abusive (so par for the course for online gaming). There are other minor issues but my current PC is only able to run the game smoothly on low graphics settings and it still looks and plays very well never has a surefire kill been stolen from me due to lag or glitches of any kind. I was skeptical of this game for a while which is why it took me so long to purchase and play but i have no regrets about my purchase and i only have high hopes for the future of this fine peice of electronic entertainment. 9/10 I would definitely reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys a good contemporary shoot em up.

review: Grand Theft Auto V review for online and story mode!First off Story Mode is personally my most favorite part about this game. (even though they canceled the DLC for story mode for some GTA Online t.) The reason I love story mode the most because of how they re introduced you to the fantasized version of california San Andreas. Also with the characters. Micheal De Santa is an ex crook who "retired" and moved to the richer part of Los Santos from North Yankton to get away from his problems. But then he got even more problems when he moved away. Then comes Franklin Clinton who is hands down my favorite character just because of how much he develops through the game. He lives in the southern part of San Andreas around where Grove Street was in GTA SA. He went from doing grunt work by repoing cars to living in Vinewood hills in an awesome house givein to him by one of his friends. Then there is Trevor Phillips. He is a VERY interesting man. Trevor worked with Micheal back before he retired. When he thought Micheal was a dead man after he escaped the cops in the first scene in the game he moved to the hillbilly/redneck part of San Andreas. When he got settled in he still persued criminal actions and cooked meth. So I reccommend this game for Story Mode. I played it about 1 3 times because it never gets boring.Now for Online. I loved online when I had this game on the xbox. It was just so straight forward and not a grind fest. Do missions get money buy cars and around and have fun with friends. then the game got really cool with the vehicle updates and heists. Thats when the game was still really fun and not a grind fest. But then these new updates came around where vehicles bunkers hangars and etc. would cost over 1 mil. And by the time you got that and got the money u needed the new update would come out with cooler items and it was repetitive grindy and became p2w. Now for my final answer I like GTA online because of what you can do on it. But it sometimes get really annoying when you have to buy a sharkcard for something to be used or for something to be done.But overall I love this game and I reccommend it to alot of people. But dont let CEO/Bunker/MC/Air Freight work get to you cuz then thats when you get annoyed and would want to stop playing it.

review: PUBG Review With the full game being released for around a month now I wanted to give a detailed review of the game and what still needs to change.Gameplay 6/10 Although a significantly polished version to the early access the gameplay still suffers from lag and stuttering issues. The main stutter the bad stutter making the game unplayable has been cleared however when on the starting area and when on the plane it suffers serverly from frame drops to around half what you would normally get. It also seems to have a problem staying at a constant fps from a long period of time I was stood still in a game to test this and still had frame drops of about 4 15 fps although some may not see this difference when you play 60fps it becomes frustrating. Despite this playing is still fun and very competitive whether playing solo or with friends. The progression of the circle isn't too random or unfair to players and the weapons are balanced in both drop rates based on it's effect on a game and against other weapons(eg. a pistol doesn't destroy someone with a scar). One thing that was rather odd was the random ammo in houses I understand why this drop exists but when you find a house non looted full of ammo only it can become rather annoying. Overall good but still needs some improvement.Graphics 9/10 This games graphics can only be described through 1 word Beautiful. It's graphics are a perfect balance of performance and asthetics although the aforementioned frame drops have meant some settings have been lowered. As I find with most games the shadows effect fps quite heavly although as I don't see a huge advantage of them in this game this can be lowered with no severe issues being had in the ways of gameplay. Weirdly the effects made a big difference for me in the case of fps but when changing it no difference could be seen. The textures again weirdly didn't seem to have an effect on my fps like alot of other games do with them on very low and every thing else bar effects and shadows being on ultra I got 80 and with textures on ultra 60 70 was what I layed at. Weird but very nice to people with lower end cards. Great work on the graphics.Mechanics 10/10 This is the main part of the game which I truly felt was polished fully bar graphics and had the most work on. Now don't get me wrong driving is broken in certain vehicles and terrain but I felt as if this made the game more enjoyable and actually made me play more messing around with the vehicles trying some stunts or running people over while trying not to flip the car on a pebble the game became more entertaining with this. The drops are balanced and not overly populated in random areas they also drop better weapons less frequently a huge plus in the way of a competitive game. The circles progression is not aggressive to a point where it becomes impossible to actually stop for a moment to clear out an area while running from the oncoming circle a very well desgined feature. The parachuting is as expected working enough(the only problem I had was a visual glitch or 2) and amazingly the opening of doors is ordinary(a little anticlimatic I know). Add ons 7/10 Now this one will be brief. The cases are not bad but at the same time not great. Any microtransactions no matter what they do are good. You shouldn't have to pay to do anything in a game it should be able to earned however in PUBG's defence you can earn the crates and open them or sell them for an item you want howevr the gamescons when they were avaliable for purchase or the Desparado crate need keys which can not be earned which is a slap in the face if you earn them. However with the price of items being rather high on any item or than the basic tops or pants profit is significantly easier than CSGO although I still advise NO money is spent on crates or keys(I sound like a hypocrite if you look in my inventory so to clear that up all items I have were given to me uncased or bought using money from sold goods in PUBG).Overall 8/10

review: This game is by far and away the best entry in the Monster Hunter series. The only complaints below that I thought had any merit were mouse and keyboard controls (Which they said they're working on) that can be circumvented entirely with a gamepad (how monster hunter has been played since it's creation) and online connectivity issues. If you have ever wondered what the craze about monster hunter has been in the past this is the best entry to give it a try on.Cut scene fights to progress the story can't be STARTED with friends but they can come help with an SOS flare. I can see how people would think that is tedious. But if we take a step back and realize that in all past entries urgent quests to progress the story had to be done offline solo with no option to call in help I'd rather have a tedious work around than no option to have friends help at all.The ports great don't be dissuaded by the negativity.

review: Monster Hunter World has been the most fun game I have played in a long time. I have only played 2 games before this and I would say it's a great improvement and change to the other series. The attacks and dodges are more responsive. No need to hassel and paintball monsters every couple minutes. Extra inventory by not needing to prepare paintballs nets and pickaxes. Ability to play bowguns similar to a third person shooter (playing range on the DS was a nightmare). Maps are huge with secret camps NPCS and cats scattered around. Monster on monster action!!! The weapon upgrade tree is amazing. The environment has so many cool interactions with basic attacking or even using the slinger shot on flash bugs healing wasps sleeping/ paralysis toads etc. I could continue talking to someone for hours about this game.As for the cons I would say like many other people the disconnecting part sucks. Sometimes I cannot join a matchmaking lobby or my friend's game. The way I have found that seems to work is to start offline then join an online lobby. Also the connection seems to work better if you join one with more people in it instead of a private lobby. Another con is that there's people but it's rare to actually hunt with a random person. People seem to stick to themselves or their groups. Also since the maps are so large without the scoutflies guiding you up and down the levels it can be very confusing when on an expedition. Plus those egg quests are always awful.

review: It's a great well made game that's clearly had a lot of time put into by people who know what they are doing. The campaign is a good mixture of funny and enticing and I'm looking forward to putting more time into the single player. Despite this it's not the best GTA ever made. I personally prefer the style of the other GTA's (San Andreas comes to mind) where you only play as one character as I believe you feel more connected to that character as they go through a story line. It wouldn't have been the same if you could actually play as Ryder or Wu Zi back in the day.The online is great fun the first few days of playing it with my friends was nothing but hilarious however once the excitement passes and you need something "more" to keep you playing I feel GTA V falls behind other somewhat similar games such as Altis Life on Arma 3. First of all as someone who preordered I received enough money as a gift to buy the best appartment and one of the best cars. After doing a few heists I could then afford the best car. Umm now what? Mindless races and missions are fun for a while but it could be so much better if there was more to spend your money on. Barely a month after the game came out and I haven't wanted to play online for a while.Overall I can see why many people love this game and definately recommend you to try it.

review: This game is fun as hell to play with as a survivor or killer but here is why i wouldnt reccomend playing it even though i will still continue to play it myself 1. The survivors are very toxic they will take the game hostage and try to taunt the killer right at the exit gates so they can hurridly leave (even if you play as freddy which i do and blood warden really isnt useful in that sense actually)2. it takes an outrageous ammount of time (as a killer) to find a ing game to play (for me its about 30 minutes per match but ive seen others where its an hour wait) and then people will DC as soon as they realize its freddy fun right?3. As a survivor many killers just want to camp you if your on the hook because usually people will try to unhook you so actually trying to unhook people just goes away once you know the killer wants to camp everyone they catch. 4. Survivors will constantly go through windows or stay around pallets to intentionally waste your time and then laugh about it once the round is over 5. Almost evertyime i try to play as a killer my game freezes and i disconnect from the round even though ive never had that problem as a survivor.6. The devs dont seem to care about the game. at all. Many people have had their memory whiped from the game there are still many bugs that need to be fixed and yet they want to add more killers and survivors and maps to a game that already has a good ammount of bugs in it. To me it just seems like they want to gain some money with new killers as fast as they can rather than actually trying to balance the game to help survivors and killers and to fix constantly occuring bugs that basically force people to rage quit.This game is extremly fun to play if you just want to casually get spooked for a few hours but if your actually trying to rank up....the killers are toxic and the survivors are even more toxic to deal with. This game has a lot of potential but i just cant reccomend it as it is now until there are some major changes to it / and to be honest i dont even know why im writing this the devs wont even look at it anyways because their probably too busy making the next killer/survivor designs.

Now that the mods I enjoyed are no longer supported I have absolutely no reason to even have this game installed on my computer. The online mode is full of hackers and just sucks in general so I cannot in good faith recommend purchasing this game new to anybody anymore.If you've never played this game before please purchase it second hand so that you are not feeding into the publisher's greed. It was a great game that you should experience but Take Two does not deserve another dime.
